description: Master SvelteKit: The official application framework for building Svelte apps of all sizes.

slides.title: Sapper is Dead. Long Live SvelteKit!
slides.content:
# Evolution ğŸ§¬

Sapper was the original framework.

**SvelteKit** is the successor. It uses Vite, is faster, and supports Serverless functions out of the box.

Use `npm create svelte@latest my-app` to start.

slides.title: Routing
slides.content:
# File-System Routing ğŸ“‚

Routes are defined by folders in `src/routes`.

- `src/routes/+page.svelte` -> `/`
- `src/routes/about/+page.svelte` -> `/about`
- `src/routes/blog/[slug]/+page.svelte` -> `/blog/hello-world`

slides.title: Server Side Rendering
slides.content:
# SSR by Default ğŸ–¥ï¸

SvelteKit renders your page on the server first (HTML), then "hydrates" it with JavaScript on the client.

This is great for SEO and perceived performance.

Layouts
slides.content:
# +layout.svelte ğŸ“

Define UI that persists across pages (Navbars, Footers).

```html
<!-- src/routes/+layout.svelte -->
<nav>...</nav>
<slot></slot>
<footer>...</footer>
```

slides.title: Adapters
slides.content:
# Deploy Anywhere ğŸš€

SvelteKit uses **adapters** to build for different environments.

- `adapter-auto` (Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare)
- `adapter-node` (Node.js server)
- `adapter-static` (SSG - Static Site Generation)

slides.title: API Routes
Stores in SvelteKit
slides.content:
# App Stores ğŸª

SvelteKit provides useful stores.

```javascript
import { page, navigating, updated } from '$app/stores';

$page.url.pathname; // Current path
$page.params; // Route params
```

slides.title: Code Example
Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: SvelteKit ğŸ“

The Metadata Framework.

- **SSR & SSG:** Fast & SEO friendly.
- **Routing:** Filesystem based (`+page.svelte`).
- **Loaders:** Server data fetching (`load`).
- **Actions:** Form handling.
- **Adapters:** Deploy everywhere.
